title: (x) A Chorus Line geometric sans logo - Pinto Inline {Rainer}
content:
Does anyone know the name of the font used for title of the musical "A Chorus Line"? Any help very much appreciated! (it can be seen here: [http://achorusline.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20101003091647/http:/achorusline.com/ "http://achorusline.com"). If you go there thanks in advance for taking the time -- it's really above & beyond.)

Thanks!

Jen
author: mrseaves

comments.content:
[ITC Busorama Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20101003091647/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/itc-busorama-bold/) is the closest Busorama I could find, but it's still not a match. Many of the characters are different, most notably the <cite>H</cite> and <cite>U</cite>.

Either it's been heavily customized or it's different face entirely.
Nah, it's the "classic" pre-digital enhanced version. The alternates never made it to the digital fonts.
Ah, so it _has_ been heavily customized -- by ITC! :D

For the archives: Correction after a few months.

It should be [Pinto Inline](http://web.archive.org/web/20101003091647/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=50304), Mecanorma.

Please remove ID above, thank you.
